results.content: The demo application which you are building is using very strange/old architecture and patterns, not always following the SOLID principles nor following the clean architecture principles (for example: injecting repositories in the UI project is not a good practice). I hope this changes during the course (now in Section 5). This is actually not a Complete guide (as the title mentioned) because a lot of basic blazor concepts are not explained (like @inject,  @functions, etc...). I'm also missing integration with existing Identity Providers like Azure AD / B2C (or at least the difference between your method and the other methods).

results.content:
IF YOU WANT TO FINALLY DEMYSTIFY BLAZOR, STOP WHAT YOU'RE DOING AND TAKE THIS COURSE!

This course is, by far, the most comprehensive start-to-finish course I've found on Blazor thus far. Bhrugen does an amazing job at walking you through the entire app development lifecycle without barely any handholding. Throughout the course, Bhrugen will frequently introduce new concepts at their most basic level and I would often find myself asking, "Well yeah, but what about THIS", and nearly every time my question would answered within just a few minutes as he would continue in demonstrating more advanced usage and/or patterns.

I would HIGHLY recommend this course for anyone who wants to see an ACTUAL real world implementation of Blazor (or anyone who is tired of sifting through Github for sample projects that might or might not work).

Thanks for an amazing course Bhrugen!

results.content:
This is an excellent course!

I am not a web developer, but this course has given a step-by-step instruction on how to use blazor to build api/server/client modules.

There are a few things that could be improved I think, specifically using constants or from configs for "magic strings" (for example, "bearer", and public key) or use property getters to return total cost as an operation of days and daily price.
But these are minor annoyances (for me!), and this does not take anything away from the excellent course content.

I liked the debugging aspects in particular, and this is a great course to come back to, again and again, for tips and tricks!

A definite 5* course!

response.content: Thank you for the great feedback!
